PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: When the PSC devices were fabricated with an inverted architecture ( ITO / ZnO / polymer : PC71BM / MoO 3 / Ag ) in order to further improve the photovoltaic performance , the PCEs of PTATDPP and PTAFDPP - based devices were improved to 7.02% and 5.22% , respectively ( Fig.

Let's think step by step.

Sure, I can help you identify the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph. Here are the entities I found:

1. PSC devices - This is a Property Name entity, as it refers to a specific type of device (photovoltaic solar cells) that has a specific structure or composition.
2. ITO - This is a Property Name entity, as it refers to a specific material (indium tin oxide) that is used in the fabrication of the PSC devices.
3. ZnO - This is a Property Name entity, as it refers to a specific material (zinc oxide) that is used in the fabrication of the PSC devices.
4. polymer : PC71BM - This is a Property Name entity, as it refers to a specific type of polymer (poly[7,7,10,10-tetracyano-2,3-benzothiazole]) that is used in the fabrication of the PSC devices.
5. MoO3 - This is a Property Name entity, as it refers to a specific material (molybdenum oxide) that is used in the fabrication of the PSC devices.
6. Ag - This is a Property Name entity, as it refers to a specific material (silver) that is used in the fabrication of the PSC devices.
7. PCEs - This is a Property Name entity, as it refers to the photovoltaic conversion efficiency of the PSC devices.
8. PTATDPP - This is a Property Name entity, as it refers to a specific type of device (PTATDPP-based device) that is fabricated using a specific combination of materials.
9. PTAFDPP - This is a Property Name entity, as it refers to a specific type of device (PTAFDPP-based device) that is fabricated using a specific combination of materials.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

4. MoO3
5. Ag

These are the entities that are directly related to the material properties of the PSC devices.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: When the PSC devices were fabricated with an inverted architecture ( ITO / ZnO / polymer : PC71BM / MoO 3 / Ag ) in order to further improve the photovoltaic performance , the PCEs of PTATDPP and PTAFDPP - based devices were improved to 7.02% and 5.22% , respectively ( Fig.

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Property Value" entities:

1. Photovoltaic performance
2. Power Conversion Efficiency (PCE)
3. Percentage (%)

Explanation:

1. Photovoltaic performance refers to the overall ability of a solar cell or device to convert sunlight into electrical energy.
2. Power Conversion Efficiency (PCE) is a measure of the efficiency of a solar cell or device to convert sunlight into electrical energy. It is defined as the ratio of the maximum power output to the maximum power input under standard test conditions.
3. Percentage (%) is a unit of measurement used to express the value of a quantity as a fraction or proportion of 100. In this case, it is used to express the PCE values as a percentage of the maximum possible value.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here are the relevant entities in the given paragraph that refer to the value of material properties:

1. Power Conversion Efficiency (PCE)
2. Percentage (%)

Explanation:

1. Power Conversion Efficiency (PCE) is a measure of the efficiency of a solar cell or device to convert sunlight into electrical energy. It is defined as the ratio of the maximum power output to the maximum power input under standard test conditions.
2. Percentage (%) is a unit of measurement used to express the value of a quantity as a fraction or proportion of 100. In this case, it is used to express the PCE values as a percentage of the maximum possible value.
